name: Blini With Smoked Herring Topping
description: Herring is a classic accompaniment for blini. A fish high in omega-3 fats, herring is sold both pickled and smoked. I use canned smoked herring for this topping. If you’ve never tasted herring preserved this way, you’re in for a treat.
keywords: appetizer, buckwheat blini, smoked herring, healthy
recipeIngredient: 1-6 7/10-ounce can smoked herring in oil, drained (4 4/10 oz. smoked herring)
1/4 cup finely chopped celery heart (tender inner stalks)
Thinly sliced radishes, along with chopped fresh dill and dill sprigs for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Crumble the smoked herring into a bowl. Add the celery, dill, lemon juice and yogurt. Stir together. The herring should be finely flaked, like canned tuna. Season with freshly ground pepper.
Warm the blini, and top with small spoonfuls of the herring mixture. Garnish with radish slices and dill, and serve.
